main event: A commercial airlines pilot observed a bright light in the sky while flying over Torrance, California, on March 11, 1967.
interesting points: The pilot reported the light was approximately 50 to 100 feet in diameter and traveling at a speed estimated at 3,000 to 4,000 mph., The object passed by his aircraft while he was flying at 21,000 feet and at a speed of 320 mph., The Dayton control tower confirmed the radar tracking of the object during the incident., The pilot described the light as brilliant white and expressed uncertainty regarding its origin., The event was documented as part of a Project Blue Book record presenting conflicting data regarding the details.
witness description: Commercial Airlines Pilot S. C. Pierson
